content:
I am currently a PhD student at the Interdisciplinary Graduate Program in Quantitative Biosciences of Georgia Institute of Technology starting from Fall 2023. I work at the intersection of machine learning and neuromechanics.
I obtained my Master’s Degree in School of Electrical and Computer Engineering at Georgia Institute of Technology. I obtained my BEng in Software Engineering and BSc in Biological Sciences at Sichuan University, China, in 2021.
I was a Research Assistant in School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering at Shanghai Jiao Tong University working with Hesheng Wang, PhD. I was an Assistant Investigator in Lab of Neural Interface, Institute of Neuroscience, Chinese Academy of Sciences, working with Zhengtuo Zhao, PhD. I was an Undergraduate Research Assistant in the Department of Neurology, Massachusetts General Hospital, Harvard Medical School, working with Wei-Long Zheng, PhD. I was also a Summer Fellow in School of Computer Science and Electronic Engineering at University of Essex, United Kingdom, working with Junhua Li, PhD.
Download my resumé .
summary: I am currently a PhD student at the Interdisciplinary Graduate Program in Quantitative Biosciences of Georgia Institute of Technology starting from Fall 2023. I work at the intersection of machine learning and neuromechanics.
title: Shu Gong

content: Integrated algorithms of robot motion planning, VSLAM, 3D reconstruction, control, and kinematics
summary: Integrated algorithms of robot motion planning, VSLAM, 3D reconstruction, control, and kinematics
title: Image-Guided Surgery Software

summary: Deep learning has achieved excellent performance in a wide range of domains, especially in speech recognition and computer vision. Relatively less work has been done for electroencephalogram (EEG), but there is still significant progress attained in the last decade. Due to the lack of a comprehensive and topic widely covered survey for deep learning in EEG, we attempt to summarize recent progress to provide an overview, as well as perspectives for future developments. We first briefly mention the artifacts removal for EEG signal and then introduce deep learning models that have been utilized in EEG processing and classification. Subsequently, the applications of deep learning in EEG are reviewed by categorizing them into groups, such as brain–computer interface, disease detection, and emotion recognition. They are followed by the discussion, in which the pros and cons of deep learning are presented and future directions and challenges for deep learning in EEG are proposed. We hope that this article could serve as a summary of past work for deep learning in EEG and the beginning of further developments and achievements of EEG studies based on deep learning.
title: Deep Learning in EEG: Advance of the Last Ten -Year Critical Period

content: Performed electrode-implantation neurosurgery on mice, built a signal acquisition system to collect their neural signals and motions, and analysed the data from mice using deep learning models.
summary: Performed electrode-implantation neurosurgery on mice, built a signal acquisition system to collect their neural signals and motions, and analysed the data from mice using deep learning models.
title: Cyborg Mouse

content: Designed (Solidworks), manufactured (3D Print & CNC), and assembled (cameras with light modules+ step motors + Arduino) a precise automated neurosurgery robot.
summary: Designed (Solidworks), manufactured (3D Print & CNC), and assembled (cameras with light modules+ step motors + Arduino) a precise automated neurosurgery robot.
title: Invasive Brain-Machine Interface Robot

content: Wrote a Unity3D program, developed a 3D simulated mouse, and used C# to reconstruct the activities of the electrode-implanted mouse to 3D simulated mouse in real time
summary: Wrote a Unity3D program, developed a 3D simulated mouse, and used C# to reconstruct the activities of the electrode-implanted mouse to 3D simulated mouse in real time
title: Mouse Motion Reconstruction

content: Conducted research on the multitask learning and EEG based emotion recognition and person identification
summary: Conducted research on the multitask learning and EEG based emotion recognition and person identification
title: Multitask Learning and EEG

content: Read and summarized scientific papers that were published in the past 10 years on the topic of deep learning in EEG signal processing
